fullQuestions.question: What is the primary difference between Vertical and Horizontal Scaling?
options: Vertical is adding more machines, Horizontal is adding more power to one machine
Vertical is adding more power to one machine, Horizontal is adding more machines
Vertical is for databases, Horizontal is for frontend
fullQuestions.explanation: Vertical scaling (scaling up) means adding more power (CPU, RAM) to an existing machine. Horizontal scaling (scaling out) means adding more machines to your network of resources.

fullQuestions.question: What is the main purpose of a Load Balancer?
options: To distribute incoming network traffic across multiple servers
fullQuestions.explanation: A load balancer acts as a reverse proxy and distributes network or application traffic across a number of servers to increase capacity and reliability of applications.
